This affair casts serious doubt on the prime minister's judgment. He saw fit to appoint Mr Andy Coulson as the Conservative party's director of communications when the former editor was tarred by association with the phone-hacking scandal. Why would he want such a compromised spokesman? Was he naive enough to believe Mr Andy Coulson 's assurances? Or did he not care about what had taken place? Neither scenario is very comforting.
